free_text.Learning outcomes: Understanding of advanced theories and applications in image processing and analysis
free_text.Content: Each year, part of the following topics will be selected and taught:[br/]Advanced image filtering and restoration: [br/]   [li] non-quadratic optimisation/regularisation [br/]   [li] Total Variation / wavelets[br/]   [li] Anisotropic diffusion[br/]   [li] PDE's & scale spaces[br/]Segmentation[br/]   [li] graph-based optimisation & segmentation, dynamic programming, Dyskstra[br/]   [li] Active contours and related topics: snakes (parametric), level sets, appearance models[br/]   [li] Spatio-temporal segmentation and tracking: feature-based clustering, Kalman filtering, IMM, particle filters[br/]Super-resolution: multiple images / measurements / views[br/]Motion analysis and optical flow: spatio-temporal constrained, pel-recursive, block matching, phase correlation[br/]Advanced image and video compression: transform-based coding, motion-compensated coding, analysis/synthesis coding
free_text.Keywords: Image processing, image analysis, filtering, segmentation, motion, compression
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Image Procesing I and II (Master level EPFL-SMT) or equivalent
